resources.string: A classic steakhouse designed with a nostalgic decor that is reflective of the 1960s era, offers steaks that are dry aged to perfection.
A seasonal raw bar. Globally-influenced and innovative seafood dishes. A broad but carefully-curated selection of wine, craft beers and coctails.
Chelsea Market 75 Ninth Avenue New York, New York 10011
Fresh, homemade, and high quality are not just catchwords. They are our foundation. Our menu is firmly rooted in the traditions of Southern bar-b-que.
We strive to elevate the burger experience to its top shelf - because you and your burger deserve it.
Dominique Bistro brings a touch of France to the cultured and eclectic neighborhood of West Village.
14 Christopher St, New York City, NY 10014-3523
delicious and unpretentious, from small plate delights to comfort food favorites and eclectic seasonal choices. plus a carefully chosen wine list to explore and enjoy….
Our corned beef and pastrami is cured using a slower method, which best flavors the meat, without injecting chemicals, water, or other additives to speed the process.
205 East Houston Street New York City, 10002
Mon-Wed 8:00am-10:45pm Thu 8:00am-2:45am Fri 8:00am- all night Sat-Sun open all day

the Russ and Daughters Cafe takes the appetizing classics for which Russ and Daughters is famous and presents them in a beautiful setting that evokes Russ and Daughters’ timeless appeal, history, and haimishness.

MoMA is a place that fuels creativity, ignites minds, and provides inspiration. Its extraordinary exhibitions and collection of modern and contemporary art are dedicated to helping you understand and enjoy the art of our time.

The museum is located in the Main Building of the former immigration station complex. The French Renaissance Revival structure, restored to its 1918 - 1924 appearance, tells the moving tales of the 12 million immigrants who entered America through the golden door of Ellis Island
Battery Park and Liberty Island, New York City, NY 10017

The Met Fifth Avenue presents over 5,000 years of art spanning all cultures and time periods. Since the Museum opened its doors to the public in its current location in Central Park in 1880, its footprint has expanded to cover more than two million square feet.
The National September 11 Memorial and Museum is a place of remembrance honoring those who perished in the terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001 and February 26, 1993.

The Stephen A. Schwarzman Building of the New York Public Library, originally called the Central Building[4] and more widely known as the Main Branch or as the New York Public Library,[a] is the flagship building in the New York Public Library system and a prominent historic landmark in Midtown Manhattan.
476 5th Ave New York, NY 10018, New York City, NY, 10035

The Merchants House Museum, known formerly as the Old Merchants House and as the Seabury Tredwell House, is the only nineteenth-century family home in New York City preserved intact — both inside and out.
Thursday, 12 to 8 p.m.; Friday to Monday, 12 to 5 p.m.
The Frick Collection is an art museum located in the Henry Clay Frick House on the Upper East Side in Manhattan.

Governed by the Metropolitan Museum of Art, its early collection was built by Barnard, which was acquired by Rockefeller, who in 1931 purchased the site at Washington Heights as a permanent home for the works.
99 Margaret Corbin Dr, New York, NY 10040

Central Park is an urban park in Manhattan, New York City, U.S. state of New York. It comprises 843 acres (341 ha) between the Upper West Side and Upper East Side, roughly bounded by Fifth Avenue on the east
New York, United States of America

Times Square is a major commercial intersection, tourist destination, entertainment center and neighborhood in the Midtown Manhattan section of New York City at the junction of Broadway and Seventh Avenue. It stretches from West 42nd to West 47th Streets.
The Empire State Building is a 102-story Art Deco skyscraper in Midtown Manhattan, New York City. Designed by Shreve, Lamb and Harmon and completed in 1931
"The Statue of Liberty Enlightening the World" was a gift of friendship from the people of France to the United States and is recognized as a universal symbol of freedom and democracy.
Liberty Island, New York City, NY 10004

The Brooklyn Bridge looms majestically over New York Citys East River, linking the two boroughs of Manhattan and Brooklyn. Since 1883, its granite towers and steel cables have offered a safe and scenic passage to millions of commuters and tourists, trains and bicycles, pushcarts and cars.

Rockefeller Center is a large complex consisting of 19 commercial buildings covering 22 acres (89,000 m2) between 48th and 51st Streets, facing Fifth Avenue, in New York City. Commissioned by the Rockefeller family, it is located in the center of Midtown Manhattan.
The Broadway Theatre is a Broadway theatre located in midtown Manhattan. It has a large seating capacity of 1,761, and unlike most Broadway theaters, it is actually located on Broadway.

Fifth Avenue is a major thoroughfare in the borough of Manhattan in New York City, United States. It stretches from West 143rd Street in Harlem to Washington Square North at Washington Square Park in Greenwich Village.
